DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate efficacy 12-week Internet intervention help sedentary old adult adopt maintain exercise regimen . A total 368 men woman 55 year age ( x = 60.3 ; SD 4.9 ) recruit screened line . They randomize treatment control group assess pre-test , 12 week , six month . The multivariate model significant posttest ( p = .001 ; large effect size ) six month ( p = .001 ; medium effect size ) . At posttest , intervention participation show significant improvement 13 14 outcome measure compare control group . At six month , treatment group participant find maintain large gain compare Ctrl participant 14 measure .
DOC.brief_title: Internet Intervention Promotes Physical Activity Sedentary Older Adults
DOC.detailed_description: Based treatment group user self report fitness level , activity goal , self-identified barrier exercise , program help user select exercise activity area endurance , flexibility , strengthen , balance enhancement . They return weekly automate video text support education , option change increase exercise plan , on-going problem solve overcome barrier exercise .
DOC.criteria: > 54 year age ; < 61 minute exercise per week ; internet connection ; email address young ; active ; web access ; email
